name: Penthouse
description: by Jonas Ohlsson generates critical-path CSS

name: Critical
description: by Addy Osmani generates & inlines critical-path CSS (uses Penthouse, Oust and inline-styles)

name: CriticalCSS
description: by FilamentGroup finds & outputs critical CSS

name: mod_pagespeed
description: Apache module for automatic PageSpeed optimization

name: ngx_pagespeed
description: Nginx module for automatic PageSpeed optimization

name: critical-css-casperjs
description: CasperJS script to pull critical CSS information from pages

name: dr-css-inliner
description: PhantomJS script to inline above-the-fold CSS on a page.

name: inline-styles
description: by Max Ogden, replaces <link> tags with inline <style> tags + inlines CSS url() calls with data URIs

name: gulp-inline-source
description: by Filip Malinowski, replaces <link> tags with inline <style> tags, and replaces <script src=""> tags with their inline content

name: inline-critical
description: by Ben ZÃ¶rb, inline critical path CSS and load existing stylesheets with loadCSS

name: isomorphic-style-loader for Webpack
description: allows to extract critical CSS for any given page/screen in React apps and inline it into HTML during server-side rendering (SSR). See React Starter Kit as an example.

name: loadCSS
description: loads CSS asynchronously using JS. Research that led to this is also available.

name: async & conditional loading
description: POC script for loading CSS files asynchronously and conditionally based on body tag classes

name: basket.js
description: async script/resource loader with support for localStorage caching. Can be extended to load stylesheets.

name: Snippet by Paul Kinlan. Patrick Hamann has an exercise using the snippet you can try out.
PageSpeed Insights
description: Online tool that measures the performance of a page for mobile devices and desktop devices. It fetches the url twice, once with a mobile user-agent, and once with a desktop-user agent.

name: PSI
description: Node module for PageSpeed Insights reporting as part of your build process. Use directly with Gulp or use grunt-pagespeed if a Grunt user. For local testing, a write-up using this task and ngrok is available.

name: PageSpeed Insights DevTools extension
description: Chrome extension for running PageSpeed tests from inside the browser.

name: PageSpeed Insights Checker for mobile extension
description: checks Mobile PageSpeed score for every page and gives you a handy preview.

name: UnCSS removes unused CSS from pages, allowing you to reduce the global CSS you may need to load in for your site. Tasks are available for Grunt, Gulp and other build tools.
